text: Find the oldest file (recursively) in a directory
I'm writing a Python backup script and I need to find the oldest file in a directory (and its sub-directories).
I also need to filter it down to *.avi files only.
The script will always be running on a Linux machine.
Is there some way to do it in Python or would running some shell commands be better?
At the moment I'm running df to get the free space on a particular partition, and if there is less than 5 gigabytes free, I want to start deleting the oldest *.avi files until that condition is met.
